meanings.definition: The process in which energy is emitted as particles or waves
meanings.sent1: The radiations from the sun provide warmth to the Earth.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study radiations to understand how energy moves through space.
meanings.sent3: The radiations from the microwave made the popcorn pop too early!
meanings.sent4: Her smile sent out radiations of happiness that brightened the room.
meanings.sent5: The radiations of light from the fireflies lit up the night sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: The act of spreading out from a central point
meanings.sent1: The radiations of sound from the concert filled the entire hall.
meanings.sent2: The radiations of heat from the fireplace kept us warm on a cold night.
meanings.sent3: The radiations of laughter from the comedy show reached every corner of the room.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness had a way of spreading like radiations of positivity to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The radiations of color from the painting brightened up the dull room.

meanings.definition: The energy emitted in the form of electromagnetic waves or particles
meanings.sent1: The radiations emitted by the nuclear reactor were carefully monitored.
meanings.sent2: Doctors use radiations to treat cancer patients effectively.
meanings.sent3: The radiations from the glowing crystal seemed to have a magical effect on the room.
meanings.sent4: His words carried radiations of wisdom that resonated with everyone in the room.
meanings.sent5: The radiations of energy from the lightning strike illuminated the dark sky.
